comment: Kim is a really good professor. You WILL learn the material in his classes. He wants you to learn it and is not unreasonable in his expectations. If you are becoming an engineer then Kim will take you there and then some. Don't ask him stupid questions that you could easily find the answer for unless you want to feel stupid. Would recommend!
Don't expect partial credit, formula sheets, curves, or material you have seen before on tests.

GREAT TEACHER! You can't go wrong if you go to class and pay attention. He makes the geotech course seem easy. I highly recommend to take Dr. Kim's Geotech class. I would take him again for any other CE classes if he teaches them.

Great teacher. He always stops to make sure that everyone understands the material. Quizzes are fairly simply and exams are somewhat similar to the homework problems. Just do the homework on your own and you'll understand the material alot better. Would definetly recommend him for CE majors.

I think Dr. Kim is the best professor in Civil engineering department. My classmates would agree with me for sure. Clear lecture, friendly attitude, practical example application during the class, and impressive and interesting research talk during the class. I need him back for foundation class.
Overall, a good professor if you are a diligent student! You just have to show him that you work hard enough  and understand the course materials.
Don't worry about homework, you'll never finish it! Other than that, Awesome teacher!

Lots of chance to pass the course. Previous exam is provided and the lowest exam score is dropped for the final grade. Lecture is clear to understand. Exam is somewhat tough but it is from the course note.  I learned alot.
He is not easy professor, but take his class if you really want to learn something. He knows what he is doing.

He is great professor for sure. I like his teaching style. The lecture is clear and exam is hard. There are many partial credits to pass the course though. I like to hear about his research in class. There are many things to learn from this smart guy!

great professor. hard tests. can't do nothing about in the higher CE classes but to take him and suffer through it. other than that brilliant professor and knows what he wants and he usually gets it by whatever means.

I failed once and took it again with Dr. Kim.  He starts class on time which is good.  Makes students work on problems after lecture that is helpful. Statics class was still tough to me but, he teaches a lot better than my first instructor.  it could have been worse if I took other's class.
Had him for Statics. This guy used to be a PE (and knows his stuff). Only take his higher lvl Civil Engr classes. Avoid all others, if you know whats good for ya.

Strange class. His lecture for the first exam was very clear but by the 2nd exam, lecture became ambiguous-concepts remained vague-& he spent little time answering student questions (he'd hurry thru answering as if it was a waste of time). Also, he is very strict (& rude) about his office hrs--& not clear there either. Avoid his class if you can.
Good professor.Lecture is easy but exam is tough. He gave lots of partial credits though. I learned alot from his class.

EXCELLENT Professor. PowerPoint presentations are very direct, helpful, and better than the actual textbook. Makes students work example problems as he teaches during his lectures which was helpful. Lets you exempt his final if you have an A going into it which is an awsome study incentive. Very intelligent too.
My exams grades: 90, 70, 92. My quiz average: 95. Then my average is a C?  I was able to learn the material very easily but he is not flexable at all.
Professor Kim is very fair and knows his material well. I would recommend him to anyone.
